sentences.sContent: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.sCn: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

sentences.sContent: ...Not many young people eligible for voting are interested in local or national elections these days...
...It is also troubling that voting rates among our youngest eligible voters—18- to 24-year-olds—are way down: Little more than one in four now go to the polls...
...a work needs a certain quality to be eligible to be swept to the top of the pile...
...That leaves the eligible pool of loan applicants wealthier...

synos.tran: 合格的，合适的；符合条件的；有资格当选的
合格者；适任者；有资格者

remMethod.val: e ＋ lig(=lect， 选择) ＋ ible → 能被选择出来的 → 合格的

trans.tranOther: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age
